newsitem.title: USA: Northwest drops top cargo posts.
newsitem.headline: Northwest drops top cargo posts.

text.p: Northwest Airlines Inc will no longer have a dedicated cargo division president or vice-president cargo finance, an airline spokesman told Reuters.
Industry sources added that the move is part of restructuring designed to boost the carrier's freight division's financial performance.
The spokesman's statement confirmed the substance of a recent internal announcement of the reorganisation.
Only a few years ago, Northwest was one of the few major U.S. airlines that had a dedicated cargo executive of vice-presidential rank within the airline. Now, it will be one of the few that does not.

The incumbent president of Northwest Cargo, Bill Slattery, held the rank of executive vice-president with the parent company. Slattery has been reassigned to the position of vice-president special projects, reporting to Northwest president and chief executive officer John Dasburg.
Ken Levinson, vice-president cargo finance and planning, has taken over new duties as vice-president of tax, risk management and insurance.
Northwest Cargo's marketing and sales functions will report to Mike Levine, the airline's executive vice-president marketing and international.
Responsibility for cargo operations, including freighter scheduling and handling, will be the responsibility of Don Washburn, executive vice-president customer service and operations.

"Integrating cargo into the mainstream of Northwest's operating and marketing structures will help us even better coordinate services for passengers and shippers," Dasburg said in a recent internal announcement to staff.

However, industry sources said that Levine, widely credited with the greatly improved performance of Northwest's passenger results, felt that a more intensive cargo marketing strategy under his supervision would improve the division's bottom line. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax +44 171 542 5017
